name: BEWARE!: Gremlins play with ECB cookies and widgets
author: HipMaestro

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
I figured I should post this alert just in case there are other ECB members that have been experiencing log-in problems like I have lately.

Turns out it was a combination of manually removing cookies for the ECB forum and also re-entering the auto-login username/password for the widget I have on these browsers. For some reason, it had placed a blank in the username field. Who knows why and who knows why it chose to do it a few days ago? Kismet, I suppose.

I had a PM with MrZork who seemed to have experienced something similar during the same period and he indicated that the "Delete all board cookies" hyperlink at the bottom of the ECB screen doesn't work.

Bottom line is: Should you experience any log-in problems on the ECB yourself, manually purge the applicable cookies before investigating any other possibilities. Also check what is being stored in the fields of your auto-log widget if you have one in use.

Gremlins must start their fiscal action policy in March after resting during the holidays. I can imagine no other cause. BTW, they must be ECB gremlins (the ones with the ghostly-blue aura) because I had no problems logging in anywhere else.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
A follow-up:

Apparently, the forum support team finally got the "Stay Logged In" issue resolved and needed to change the cookie structure enough to make the login a problem unless a member manually removed the old cookies. But once it is done, the account will now stay logged in until it is personally logged off. Just make sure to check the box next to the Login button if you want it to do that for you.

Now... back to our regularly-scheduled program...
